problem.p: This is a concept question, provided to check your understanding of the previous video clip.
Which of the following statements about quantum measurement and density matrices are correct? Check all that apply:

choice.text: After a quantum measurement on a density matrix state, the post-measurement state is always a pure state.
The post-measurement state is always a mixed state.
After quantum measurement on a pure state, the post-measurement state is always a mixed state.
After quantum measurement on a pure state, if the measurement result is known, the post-measurement state is always a pure state.
Measurement on a density matrix represented by a specific ensemble of pure states, always simply projects into one of the ensemble of states.
Measurement on a density matrix state sometimes results in a pure state, but may also result in a mixed state.
